pr_title: Bael 4457 list of json objects with rest template

timeline.message: BAEL-4457 demo app with Object array and ParameterizedTypeReference example

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to both provide constructor injection and field injection. You may find that you can take @Autowired off the field and things work. Depending on the version of Spring you may need to add @Autowired to the constructor, though these days it's not needed.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: static members should be the first thing in a class - this should be moved up top.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: Is it also possible to serialize the response as User[] too?
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: This POJO is more complex than it needs to be for the example. We're just looking for a situation where there's a list of objects coming back from an endpoint. This object has a list of other things in it. That seems off topic.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

replies.bodyText: I think the ticket or the stackoverflow link mentioned processing nested objects - I think it is a good example to see
replies.author: Trixi-Turny

timeline.bodyText: While it may be good practice to extract interfaces from services, this interface seems to complicate this simple example. We could just as easily do without it.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

replies.bodyText: We don't need to include this bit in the article, but as you say it is good practice so I would prefer to leave it in unless you REALLY object it. :)
replies.author: Trixi-Turny

timeline.bodyText: It might be cleaner to use Arrays.asList here, statically importing it. You don't need to assign that to a new ArrayList.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: I don't see any use of Mockito in this test.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: Maybe use an assertion where you compare the full list, rather than just checking bits of it. AssertJ's assertThat(...).containsExactly(...) would do it, but you can use JUnit's assertThat(object, hamcrestMatcher) too if you prefer.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: redundant whitespace
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: It may be necessary to unit test controllers in production code, but it's overkill for this example.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: You're only testing one of the two endpoints here.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.message: BAEL-4457 add more examples of processing the objects and address comments

timeline.bodyText: public seems to be in the wrong place here. I'd expect annotations before public. There's a missing space between () and {
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: the url doesn't match the behaviour
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze
ashleyfrieze
ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: misleading name
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText:
Is this an essential part of the example? Are you not mocking it out in the tests/example code.
We're only interested in the consumer of this API, not the producer.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

replies.bodyText: Thank you! I realise this is not needed now.
replies.author: Trixi-Turny

timeline.bodyText: If it's the same user JSON each time, maybe extract to a constant?
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.message: BAEL-4457 remove new ArrayList and put @ResponseBody before public
BAEL-4457 use a service instead of another controller
BAEL-4457 use ObjectMapper to extract usernames from objects
BAEL-4457 delete provider service and controller
BAEL-4457 use functional interface where possible
BAEL-4457 remove unnecessary annotations and tidy indents for exchange()

timeline.bodyText: These are very heavily indented. Please check the indentation style. I suspect they should be indented by 2 additional spaces, rather than 12.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: Please look at all of the continuation indentation
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: This super() is unnecessary - let's remove it.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: The space in the URL is unexepcted
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.message: BAEL-4457 use @JsonCreator and @JsonProperty and resolve comments

timeline.bodyText:
A couple of mild stylistic points here:

// Given and // When and // Then appeared somewhere on the internet as a commenting standard in tests, and on the whole it adds very little. It may be good to finish the sentence // Given a user service that returns three users but otherwise, it's just boilerplate

Small aside here, your mockServer.expect is actually part of your Given clause in the above, but appears as a When!

There's no need to assert both the size and the exact content of a list - the second automatically implies the first.
2.5. If you're using assertJ, and I recommend it a lot, then let's not mix it with JUnit's own assertEquals
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.message: BAEL-4457 remove comments and use assertj core lib for assertions

timeline.bodyText: use a two-space indent for continuations
